author: Staff Reporter
text:
The Hindu Young World , in association with Thyrocare, will conduct a painting competition for school students from Standard IV to Standard IX on March 13.

Students should choose any one of the given topics and draw the painting on a white drawing sheet and forward it for the preliminary selection. Their paintings should be certified by their principal or art teacher that it was the original work of the participant and they should write their name, class, school, residential address, mobile number and email id on the backside of the drawing sheet.

The selected students will be intimated through email and they have to come to the venue (with the intimation letter) at their own cost on the specified date to participate in the finals.

Topics for junior (Class IV to VI) include at the toy/pet store, gully cricket, Sunday family picnic, cleaning my street, a day at the zoo, at the circus, water birds, scenes from a village, first visit to the public library and summer activities.

Topics for senior (Class VII to IX) include beach clean-up, camping out, new year carnival, classical/rock music concert, book fair, under water life, portraits of emotions, if dinosaurs existed today, domesticating the wild, retelling your favourite fairy tale and life without technology.

Registration

For registration and other details, students have to log on to: www.thehindu.com/ywpainting where they can get their unique ID. Entries should be sent to The Hindu , Circulation Dept., Raja Towers, II Floor, 49/5, Second Floor, New Bus Stand Road, Meyyanur, Salem – 636 004 before February 27. Finals will be held on March 13 in Salem.
title: Entries invited for The Hindu Young World painting contest
